description:
Design a class to find the k-th largest element in a stream.

- `KthLargest(int k, int[] nums)` initializes the object with the integer `k` and the stream of integers `nums`.
- `int add(int val)` appends the integer `val` to the stream and returns the element representing the k-th largest element in the stream.

Note: It is the k-th largest element in sorted order, not the k-th distinct element.

See the full problem on [LeetCode 703](https://leetcode.com/problems/kth-largest-element-in-a-stream/).
constraints: At most 10^4 calls will be made to add
It is guaranteed that there will be at least k elements in the array when you search for the k-th element
